reason: Claim III.2 asserts Var_{mu_eps^{(alpha)}}(X_eps) >= c_0 > 0 uniformly in eps and alpha, but this is not proven. The Brascamp-Lieb inequality only gives an UPPER bound on variance. A lower bound requires a separate argument (e.g., that the covariance C_W of the modified Gaussian satisfies <psi_eps, C_W psi_eps> >= c_0, which follows from C_W <= C and the fact that sigma_eps^2 has a positive limit, but should be stated). This is minor because Claim III.2 is a negative result (divergence of L^p norms) that no subsequent node depends on for a positive conclusion.
